label: 檀那, 布施
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Dāna (Sk.). Giving, the 1st of the 6 virtues to be perfected by the bodhisattva. In Japan, the term danna was usually used interchangeably with 檀施, 檀越, 施主 danse, dannotsu, and seshu to refer to one who engages in giving, particularly a patron of a monk or temple (Sk. dānapati).
